question: The birth anniversary of which Indian freedom fighter was celebrated on January 28, who was also called as ‘Punjab Kesari’?
explanation:
The 155th birth anniversary of the great Indian freedom fighter Lala Lajpat Rai was observed on January 28 across the country.
He earned the titles of ‘Punjab Kesari’ and ‘Lion of Punjab’ for his ideology of nationalism and freedom. He was part of the nationalist trio of Lal-Bal-Pal, which comprised of Lala Lajpat Rai, Bal Gangadhar Tilak, and Bipin Chandra Pal. The trio advocated Swadeshi movement to use Indian made goods across the nation and to boycott imported goods. He was brutally injured during the protest against Simon Commission and died shortly from a heart attack.
